reviewText:
Two funny George Michael's clips of a bit different gender and common unforgettable appearance:
"Shot the Dog" is a cartoon epitomizing then US President G.W.Bush and UK PM T. Blaire with their intention to root out terrorism by changing Iraqi regime- a nice song and surely much more drag-queens involved performing quite comprehensible and understood than Yellow Submarin story itself
"Freek" is a visually sexy theatrical musical of which language needs some preparation at school sex lessons while the rest is for a general viewing.

Very short DVD is nice for outstanding talents producers demonstrate.
